newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan seen tendering for 330,000 tonnes wheat.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan seen tendering for 330,000 tonnes wheat.

text.p: Pakistan is likely to tender next week for 330,000 tonnes of soft white wheat for May-June delivery, a trade source in Islamabad said on Friday.
The source, who asked not to be identified, said the tender, likely to be for wheat of optional origin, would be the first purchase in the new wheat crop year (May-April).
He said the government had authorised plans to buy four million tonnes of wheat in the new crop year, including two million tonnes in the next six months.

Pakistan bought 2.355 million tonnes of wheat in the last crop year, of which the United States supplied 1.86 million tonnes and Australia 495,000 tonnes. It imported 1.9 million tonnes of wheat the previous year.
Wheat flour shortages have sparked unrest in several Pakistani cities in recent weeks. Government officials have blamed the shortages on smuggling to neighbouring countries.
